pullRequest.title: Add new stirmzi-view cluster role and configure aggregation to view, edit and admin roles
pullRequest.bodyText:
Type of change

Enhancement / new feature

Description
Currently, we have in our installation folder the strimzi-admincluster role which can be used to manage Strimzi resources. This PR adds additional stirmzi-view cluster role which can be used only for read access.
It also configures the aggregation so that these roles are automatically added to the system roles:

strimzi-admin to admin and edit roles
strimzi-view to view role

nodes.bodyText: "allows users" or "is used" ... there is a typo somewhere :-)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,13 @@
 = Strimzi Administrators
 
 {ProductName} includes several custom resources.
-By default, permission to create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
-If you want to allow non-cluster administators to manage {ProductName} resources, you must assign them the Strimzi Administrator role.
+By default, permission to view, create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
+{ProductName} provides two additional `ClusterRoles` which you can use to assign these rights also to other users.
+The role `strimzi-view` allows used to view and list the {ProductName} resources.

nodes.bodyText: "them" is used twice here with different meanings, maybe it's better to specify "users" and "{ProductName} resources" ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,13 @@
 = Strimzi Administrators
 
 {ProductName} includes several custom resources.
-By default, permission to create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
-If you want to allow non-cluster administators to manage {ProductName} resources, you must assign them the Strimzi Administrator role.
+By default, permission to view, create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
+{ProductName} provides two additional `ClusterRoles` which you can use to assign these rights also to other users.
+The role `strimzi-view` allows used to view and list the {ProductName} resources.
+The role `strimzi-admin` allows them to also create, edit or delete them.

nodes.bodyText:
Strimzi provides custom resources for configuration of your deployment.
I actually deleted this assembly and moved the procedure into a pre-install prep assembly for the deployment guide PR. I also did some minor edits to the procedure
Will need to make sure the changes in this PR are reflected.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,13 @@
 = Strimzi Administrators
 
 {ProductName} includes several custom resources.
-By default, permission to create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
-If you want to allow non-cluster administators to manage {ProductName} resources, you must assign them the Strimzi Administrator role.
+By default, permission to view, create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
+{ProductName} provides two additional `ClusterRoles` which you can use to assign these rights also to other users.
+The role `strimzi-view` allows used to view and list the {ProductName} resources.
+The role `strimzi-admin` allows them to also create, edit or delete them.
+When you install these roles, they will automatically add (aggregate) these rights to the default Kubernetes `ClusterRoles`.
+`strimzi-view` will aggregate to the `view` role and `strimzi-admin` to the `edit` and `admin` roles.

nodes.bodyText: If needed? If we're designating strimzi admins, we would need to do this step, no?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11,14 +11,14 @@
 
 .Procedure
 
-. Create the `strimzi-admin` cluster role in Kubernetes.
+. Create the `strimzi-view` and `strimzi-admin` cluster roles in Kubernetes.
 +
 Use `kubectl apply`:
 [source,shell,subs=+quotes]
 kubectl apply -f install/strimzi-admin
 
-. Assign the `strimzi-admin` `ClusterRole` to one or more existing users in the Kubernetes cluster.
+. If needed, assign the roles to one or more existing users in the Kubernetes cluster.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Thanks to the aggregation, you might not need to assign these roles to users who already have similar rights.
          
          
            
            Because of the aggregation, you might not need to assign these roles to users who already have similar rights.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,13 @@
 = Strimzi Administrators
 
 {ProductName} includes several custom resources.
-By default, permission to create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
-If you want to allow non-cluster administators to manage {ProductName} resources, you must assign them the Strimzi Administrator role.
+By default, permission to view, create, edit, and delete these resources is limited to Kubernetes cluster administrators.
+{ProductName} provides two additional `ClusterRoles` which you can use to assign these rights also to other users.
+The role `strimzi-view` allows used to view and list the {ProductName} resources.
+The role `strimzi-admin` allows them to also create, edit or delete them.
+When you install these roles, they will automatically add (aggregate) these rights to the default Kubernetes `ClusterRoles`.
+`strimzi-view` will aggregate to the `view` role and `strimzi-admin` to the `edit` and `admin` roles.
+Thanks to the aggregation, you might not need to assign these roles to users who already have similar rights.
